key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 91% of itineraries are higher than the airline site, though matching fares show a slight uptick.
Most short-haul is higher, but over 80% of long-haul segments are lower, demonstrating a clear advantage for longer flights.
Over 90% of fares remain unavailable on GDS, with limited match beyond certain long-haul routes.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 91% of ODs in the channel are priced higher than the airline site, a slight improvement from last week's 92%.
OTA-lower fares remain under 1%, indicating negligible price advantage for travelers.
Matching fares edged up from 4.87% to 5.42%, reflecting mild progress in fare alignment.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Occurrences near 3%, with minimal change from the previous week.
Matching fares rose from 4.87% to 5.42%, indicating marginal improvement.
OTA-lower fares remain below 1% of itineraries.
More than 91% of fares are higher on OTA, slightly down from 92.26%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 93% are higher on OTAs, with just 3.6% matching airline fares.
75% match airline pricing, while 23% remain higher on OTAs.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over 93% of Vietnam-origin ODs are higher on OTAs, with minimal matching rates.
63% match airline fares, while nearly one-third are higher on OTAs.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA-higher fares exceed 91%, with about 5% matching.
Over 92% of far-out itineraries are higher, with OTA-lower fares nearly absent.

mse_highlights.line_content: Fares not found remain below 2% for short-haul and near 0% for long-haul.
Around one-third of short-haul matches airline pricing, while under one-fifth of long-haul does. Slight improvement this week.
Short-haul is mainly higher on MSE, but over 80% of long-haul is cheaper, demonstrating a strong advantage for distant routes.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Low frequency near 2% for short-haul, none for long-haul, reflecting stable coverage.
Short-haul parity ~32%, long-haul ~18%. Slight improvement signify better alignment with airline fares.
Dominant in 82% of long-haul; fares 6–7% below site. Over 90% lower in Non-VN routes.
Still above 50% in short-haul, typically 2–3% costlier, but easing slightly.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Over half priced higher on MSE, only ~13% lower, with ~2% not listed.
82% are cheaper, with minimal changes in higher fares. Advantage remains strong for long-haul.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: ~53% higher, ~12% lower, and ~33% parity. Small gains in matching rates.
Over 90% are lower on MSE, reinforcing a solid discount for inbound routes.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 47–60% higher on MSE, ~16% lower, though the gap is narrowing slightly.
60%+ higher on MSE, with lower fares averaging a 5% discount compared to the airline site.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 90% of fares are missing, with only minor movement from previous periods.
About 75% match airline fares on long-haul, while short-haul sees around 4% parity.
Non-VN origins see 59% parity, but VN origins show 95%+ missing fares on GDS.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Above 90% remain unavailable, slightly down from last month.
Roughly 6% match website fares, with minor weekly changes.
Less than 0.1% of itineraries are cheaper on GDS, effectively negligible.
Around 1% of fares cost more, consistent with prior observations.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 75% match, 12% missing, reflecting better alignment than short haul.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 96% missing, under 4% matching, no major signs of higher or lower pricing.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 94% non-availability, ~5% parity, 1% higher, and no lower fares.
91% missing, 8% matching, 1% higher, negligible GDS-lower fares.
